title: Installing Google Tag Manager in Prestashop CMS
question: How can I install the Google Tag Manager in the Prestashop CMS?
answer:
To install Google Tag Manager in Prestashop:

1. Log in to your Prestashop Admin Panel
2. Go to Modules > Module Manager
3. Search for "Google Tag Manager" in the search bar
4. Click "Install" on the official Google Tag Manager module
5. After installation, click "Configure"
6. Enter your GTM Container ID (format: GTM-XXXXXX)
7. You can find your Container ID in your Google Tag Manager account under Admin > Container Settings
8. Save the configuration
9. Clear your Prestashop cache: Advanced Parameters > Performance > Clear Cache
10. Test the installation using Google Tag Assistant Chrome extension

Important Notes:
- Make sure you have a Google Tag Manager account and container created before installation
- The Container ID is different from your Google Analytics tracking ID
- After installation, you can manage all your tracking tags from the GTM dashboard without touching Prestashop code

title: Prestashop Cache Clearing
question: How do I clear cache in Prestashop?
answer:
To clear cache in Prestashop:

1. Log in to your Prestashop Admin Panel
2. Navigate to Advanced Parameters > Performance
3. Scroll down to the "Clear cache" section
4. Click the "Clear cache" button
5. Wait for confirmation message

Alternative method via FTP:
1. Connect to your server via FTP
2. Navigate to /var/cache folder
3. Delete all folders inside the cache directory (dev, prod folders)
4. The cache will automatically regenerate

When to clear cache:
- After installing or updating modules
- After changing theme settings
- When changes are not visible on the frontend
- After modifying configuration settings

title: Google Analytics 4 Setup
question: How do I set up Google Analytics 4?
answer:
To set up Google Analytics 4 (GA4):

1. Create GA4 Property:
   - Go to Google Analytics admin panel
   - Click "Create Property"
   - Fill in property details (name, timezone, currency)
   - Click "Next" and complete setup

2. Get Measurement ID:
   - In GA4 property, go to Admin > Data Streams
   - Click on your web stream
   - Copy the Measurement ID (format: G-XXXXXXXXXX)

3. Install on Website:
   Option A - Using GTM (Recommended):
   - Add GA4 Configuration tag in Google Tag Manager
   - Enter your Measurement ID
   - Set trigger to "All Pages"

   Option B - Direct Installation:
   - Add GA4 tracking code to your website header
   - Replace MEASUREMENT_ID with your actual ID

4. Verify Installation:
   - Go to GA4 Reports > Realtime
   - Visit your website in another tab
   - Check if your visit appears in Realtime report

Important: GA4 is different from Universal Analytics. Make sure you are using the correct Measurement ID format (G-XXXXXXXXXX, not UA-XXXXXXXXXX)

title: Creating Custom Events in GTM
question: How do I create custom events in Google Tag Manager?
answer:
To create custom events in Google Tag Manager:

1. Create a Trigger:
   - In GTM workspace, go to Triggers
   - Click "New"
   - Choose trigger type (Click, Form Submit, etc.)
   - Configure trigger conditions
   - Save the trigger

2. Create a Tag:
   - Go to Tags section
   - Click "New"
   - Choose tag type (GA4 Event, Universal Analytics, etc.)
   - Configure event parameters
   - Attach the trigger you created
   - Save the tag

3. Test in Preview Mode:
   - Click "Preview" button
   - Enter your website URL
   - Perform the action that should trigger the event
   - Check if the tag fires in Tag Assistant

4. Publish:
   - Click "Submit" when testing is successful
   - Add version name and description
   - Click "Publish"

Common Custom Events:
- Button clicks
- Form submissions
- Video plays
- PDF downloads
- Scroll depth
- Element visibility

title: Fixing 404 Errors in Prestashop
question: How do I fix 404 errors in Prestashop?
answer:
To fix 404 errors in Prestashop:

1. Regenerate .htaccess:
   - Go to Preferences > SEO & URLs
   - Enable "Friendly URL"
   - Click "Save"
   - This regenerates the .htaccess file

2. Check URL Rewriting:
   - Verify mod_rewrite is enabled on your server
   - Test with: php -m | grep rewrite
   - If not enabled, contact your hosting provider

3. Clear Cache:
   - Go to Advanced Parameters > Performance
   - Clear cache
   - Test the URLs again

4. Check File Permissions:
   - .htaccess file should have 644 permissions
   - Use FTP to verify and update if needed

5. Regenerate URLs:
   - Go to Preferences > SEO & URLs
   - For each URL that's giving 404, click "Regenerate"
   - Save changes

6. Common Causes:
   - Missing .htaccess file
   - Incorrect rewrite rules
   - Wrong base URL in configuration
   - Module conflicts

If issues persist after these steps, check server error logs for specific error messages.
